name: La Cazalla

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying at this property was one of the highlights of our vacation. If you are interested in exterior and interior home design and like spending time in an idyllic setting then this is the place for you. For us, staying at La Cazalla added a separate and very satisfying aspect to our visit to Ronda. We are still talking about how special this property was. The house is beautiful both in its design and decor (there are many rock outcroppings incorporated into the house), there's lots of space to relax, and the outdoors are simply beautiful. Yes, there's a dirt road to travel to get to the property, but it's not that bad and adds a bit of adventure to your stay. All in all, the dirt road is a little over 1 km, and it takes less than 10 minutes (about 5 km total) to drive to "old" Ronda where many of the sights and restaurants are located. If you like a property which is not only comfortable and gorgeous, but interesting and unique as well, La Cazalla is not to be missed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If peace, tranquility and a relaxing haven are what you are looking for, then I highly recommend La Cazalla. Breathtaking scenery, total peace and seclusion, no TV's, no phone signal (!), no passing traffic, and on most occasions - the pool to yourself! This is the perfect place to unwind or grab some peace and quiet and a switch of from the usual day-to-day. The rooms are large and the home very warm and welcoming. Hosts, Maria and Rodriguez are delightful and very helpful and if you like animals, they have a pet dog (and couple of cats) that are always super-pleased to see you! The pool is surrounded by gorgeous smelling wild lavender and mint and the sunbathing areas discretely designed so that you are seated in two's with privacy and shade. The property has some lovely tracks to explore from which I understand there are some scenic walks/hikes. There is a 3km bumpy track/road (un-tarmaced) to the property, taking you down to the floor of the valley, but this was in no way a hinderance and actually added to the charm and authenticity of the property. Once at the top of the track, you are on the fringes of Rhonda, which is 10 minutes (max) from the house. I would definately return and would consider this one of the most private, delightful, beautiful and peaceful treasures that I have ever stayed in. Take a good book (or two).
reviews.title: Constrained Atmosphere

likes.disliked: — the atmosphere, route to get there, the inflexibility, small toilet with sink rather than bathroom

description: In our bedrooms you will find king sized beds, small fridges where you can keep your own snacks,water kettles and cups and also free tea and coffee envelopes for you to serve yourself at your convenience. In the bathrooms there are magnifying mirrors and hair dryers, and although the speed is not high, we have free WIFI all over the house.Breakfast is included in room price and dinners are served only if previously reserved. We have an "honesty bar" where you can have local wines,beer and refreshments, and can prepare a picnic for you if previously requested.We are in a paradisiac location, and if you are completely comfortable being surrounded by just Nature, this is the place for you.
